Define the matrices A, B and C by \[A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 2 & 1 & 2 \\ 2 & 2 & 3 \end{bmatrix}, \quad B = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 2 \\ -2 & -1 & -2 \\ 2 & 2 & 3 \end{bmatrix} \quad \text{and} \quad C = \begin{bmatrix} -1 & -2 & -2 \\ 2 & 1 & 2 \\ 2 & 2 & 3 \end{bmatrix}\]

questions.qText: Which of the following statement(s) is(are) correct?
qOptions: If a = det. (B) + det. (B\(^2\)) + det. (B\(^3\)) + ⋯⋯∞, then minimum value of a equals \(\frac{8}{\pi^3-8}\).
If b = det. adj. (B) + det. adj. (B\(^2\)) + det. adj. (B\(^3\)) + ⋯⋯∞, then maximum value of b is \(\frac{256}{\pi^6-256}\).
If a = det. (B) + det. (B\(^2\)) + det. (B\(^3\)) + ⋯⋯∞, then maximum value of a equals \(\frac{16}{\pi^3-16}\).
If b = det. adj. (B) + det. adj. (B\(^2\)) + det. adj. (B\(^3\)) + ⋯⋯∞, then minimum value of b is \(\frac{64}{\pi^6-64}\).

Choose the correct code from the options.

A → (q, s); B → (p, q, r, s); C → (q, r, s)
A → (q, r, s); B → (p, q, s); C → (q, r, s)
A → (q, r, s); B → (p, q, r, s); C → (q, s)
